title: Deconvolution of in vivo protein-RNA contacts using fractionated eCLIP-seq
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Purification of protein-RNA complexes
Timing: 2 days
The experimental pipeline has two major steps. This first step allows to purify protein-RNA complexes, constituted by the protein(s) of interest and bound fragmented RNAs from crosslinked cell lysates.
Critical: Always keep samples, buffers and reagents on ice. Frequently spray surfaces/tools/gloves with 70% ethanol and RNAse Away Reagent for decontamination.
Day 1
Cell lysis.
Prepare Lysis Mix: to 10 mL Lysis Buffer, add 400 μL Proteinase Inhibitor Cocktail (1 tablet dissolved in 400 μL H2O) and 20 μL SUPERase⋅In™ RNase Inhibitor.
Thaw crosslinked cell pellets on ice. Resuspend each pellet in 1.2 mL Lysis Mix.
Bead preparation (Dynabeads™ Protein G).
Vortex Protein G beads, supplied in a solution containing sodium azide as preservative, for 30 s to obtain a homogeneous suspension.
Per each sample, transfer 50 μL of bead suspension to a labeled Low Binding tube.
Note: The volume of Protein G beads can be scaled up or down according to the experimental conditions. Standard iCLIP-seq and eCLIP-seq suggest to use 100–125 μL beads/sample (König et al., 2010[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib8]; Van Nostrand et al., 2016[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib11]).
Place Low Binding tubes on the magnetic rack, which will collect beads on the side of the tubes.
Wait 30 s until the solution is clear.
Keeping the tubes on the magnet, remove the supernatant without disturbing beads.
Wash Protein G beads 2× with 500 μL Lysis Mix.
Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack.
Resuspend beads in 500 μL Lysis Mix.
Replace tubes onto magnetic rack.
Wait 30 s until the solution is clear and discard supernatant.
Repeat for a second time.
Resuspend beads in 500 μL Lysis Mix.
Add 12 μg of anti-FLAG antibody (12 μL of 1 mg/mL stock stored at −20°C) to the bead slurry.

Note: The amount of antibody depends on the antibody quality, purity, binding strength, and specificity. This should be optimized in preliminary experiments following manufacturer’s instructions for IP application.
Rotate tubes at 23°C for 60 min. In the meantime, go to 3. Partial RNA digestion.
When cell lysates are ready at the end of step 2, wash Protein G beads with bound antibody 2× with 500 μL Lysis Mix.
Resuspend beads in 500 μL Lysis Mix and keep on ice.
Partial RNA digestion.
Optional: Sonicate samples (not required for cytoplasmic fraction as indicated in Brugiolo et al., 2017[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3]):
Clean sonicator tip with RNAse Away Reagent before using it.
Transfer each lysate to a 15 mL tube and place the tube in an ice beaker.
Critical: Avoid foaming. Keep the probe approximately 0.5 cm from the bottom of the tube without touching tube sides.
Sonicate with 6 pulses each 10 s at 30% amplitude, 20 s pause.
Note: We use the Branson Digital Sonifier 450. Sonication conditions may need to be converted to suit another instrument.
Transfer 1.2 mL lysate to Low Binding tube.
Spin down at 16,000 × g, 4°C, 10 min.
Transfer the supernatant into a fresh Low Binding tube (leave some to prevent carryover).
Prepare a dilution of RNAse I at 1:30 in H2O [Low RNase].
Note: Several RNAse dilutions should be initially tested with the help of P32-labeling in step 9 (Huppertz et al., 2014[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7]). With a 1:50 High RNase dilution, immunoprecipitated proteins are bound to short RNAs migrating as a less diffuse band ∼5 kD above the expected molecular weight of the protein (this also helps in determining the actual protein size). With Low RNase conditions the band shifts up and becomes more diffuse.

Add 10 μL of diluted RNAse I and 5 μL of TURBO™ DNase to each lysate.
Incubate at 37°C exactly for 3 min while shaking at 1,100 rpm.
Place immediately on ice for at least 3 min.
Immunoprecipitation.
For each cell lysate, save 24 μL (2%) as pre-IP input sample for library preparation, and other 24 μL as pre-IP control for western blot. Store at 4°C.
Note: Paired pre-IP input samples are sequenced to allow normalization for background signal and potential differences in transcript abundances between conditions.
Magnetically remove the Lysis Mix from the Protein G beads with bound antibody.
Add the remaining cell lysate to the beads.
Rotate beads/lysate mix for 1 h at 4°C in the cold room.
Wash beads with bound protein-RNA complexes 3× with 800 μL High-salt Wash Buffer.
Short spin and magnetic separation (let sit for 2 min in the cold room).
Discard supernatant.
Add 800 μL High-salt Wash Buffer, vortex for few seconds until the beads are fully resuspended, 2 min rotation in the cold room.
Repeat for other 2 times.
Wash 1× with 800 μL PNK Wash Buffer for 2 min rotation in the cold room as in 4.e.
Wash 1× with 800 μL 1× FastAP Buffer for 2 min rotation in the cold room as in 4.e. At the end, remove residual buffer with fine tip.
3′ end dephosphorylation.
FastAP treatment. Prepare FastAP Master Mix for n+1 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_13.csv
Mix, add 100 μL/sample, incubate in Thermomixer at 1,200 rpm, 37°C, 15 min. Then, short spin and magnetic separation to remove Master Mix.
PNK treatment. Prepare PNK Master Mix for n+1 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_14.csv
Mix, add 300 μL/sample, incubate in Thermomixer at 1,200 rpm, 37°C, 20 min. Then, short spin and magnetic separation to remove Master Mix.

Wash beads with bound protein-RNA complexes as in 4.e.
Wash 1× with 800 μL PNK Wash Buffer for 2 min rotation in the cold room.
Wash 1× with 800 μL High-salt Wash Buffer for 2 min rotation in the cold room.
Wash 2× with 800 μL PNK Wash Buffer for 2 min rotation in the cold room.
Wash 2× with 300 μL 1× RNA Ligase Buffer for 2 min rotation in the cold room. At the end, remove residual buffer with fine tip.
3′ linker ligation.
Prepare 3′ Ligation Master Mix for n+1 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_15.csv
Mix carefully, add 25 μL/sample, flick.
To each sample, add 5 μL of a different barcoded RNA adapter at 20 μM: X1A, X1B, X2A, X2B.
Incubate at 23°C for 75 min flicking every 10 min.
Pause point: Keep at 4°C for 12–16 h.
Day 2
Wash beads with bound protein-RNA complexes as in 4.e.
Magnetically separate (let sit for 5 min) and remove supernatant.
Wash beads 1× with 800 μL PNK Wash Buffer for 2 min rotation in the cold room.
Wash 2× with 800 μL High-salt Wash Buffer for 2 min rotation in the cold room.
Wash 2× with 800 μL PNK Wash Buffer for 2 min rotation in the cold room.
Resuspend beads in 1 mL PNK Wash Buffer and keep on ice.
Dilute 4× NuPAGE™ Loading Buffer to 1.5× in H2O.
Add 20 μL 1.5× NuPAGE™ Buffer to pre-IP controls for western blot saved on Day 1.
Take out 100 μL of the 1 mL beads in PNK Wash Buffer, perform magnetic separation, discard supernatant and resuspend beads in 20 μL 1.5× NuPAGE™ Buffer as post-IP controls for western blot. Keep on ice.
Optional: P32-labeling.

Note: We usually perform radiolabeling because it helps with visualization and purification of cross-linked protein-RNA complexes after SDS-PAGE and membrane transfer, in the optimization of RNA digestion conditions and in the identification of potential non-specific signal. However, as reported in Van Nostrand et al. (2016)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib11], this is not a mandatory step.
Take out another 100 μL beads of the remaining 900 μL beads in PNK Wash Buffer. Prepare PNK Master Mix for n+1 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_16.csv
Discard the buffer from the beads, add 3.6 μL/sample.
Add 0.4 μL γ-32P-ATP (corresponding to 4 μCi).
Critical: The half-life of γ-32P-ATP is 14.3 days. Adjust γ-32P-ATP and H2O volumes accordingly (e.g., if the use date is 2 weeks after the calibration date, double γ-32P-ATP volume using 0.8 μL and reduce H2O to 2.6 μL https://www.perkinelmer.com/tools/calculatorrad/product[href=https://www.perkinelmer.com/tools/calculatorrad/product]).
Mix well by pipetting up and down and incubate in Thermomixer at 1,100 rpm, 37°C, 5 min.
Perform short spin and magnetic separation.
Discard the buffer after magnetic separation and resuspend radioactive beads in 20 μL 1.5× NuPAGE™ Buffer.
Remove the buffer from the remaining cold beads (800 μL).
Collect NuPAGE™ Buffer + radioactive beads and combine with corresponding cold beads.
Prepare samples for gel loading.
Denature experimental samples and pre-/post-IP controls for western blot in Thermomixer at 70°C, 10 min, without shaking.
Collect eluates and keep on ice. Store controls for western blot at −80°C.
SDS-PAGE and membrane transfer.
Have ready the prepared 1× SDS Running Buffer and 1× Transfer Buffer.
Use 10-well NuPAGE™ 4%–12% Bis-Tris gels. Peel off the tape and place the gel cassette into the electrophoresis tank with the lower cassette side facing you.

Note: We use the Thermo Fisher Scientific Mini Gel Tank that can allocate up to 2 gels per run. Remove the cassette clamp from the unused chamber to run only one gel. See manufacturer’s instructions available here: https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/A25977[href=https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/A25977].
Fill the tank with 1× SDS Running Buffer.
Load 20 μL eluted samples and 6 μL pre-stained protein ladder.
Critical: Leave one lane free for cutting (max 4 samples/gel). Immediately before loading, use a pipette or syringe to rinse the wells 3 times with 1× SDS Running Buffer.
Run at 180 V, 55 min.
After the gel run, cut off wells and dye front (after P32-labeling, it contains free radioactive ATP).
Soak sponge pads and filter papers in pre-cold 1× Transfer Buffer.
Use 0.45 μm nitrocellulose membranes.
Note: Nitrocellulose membranes can represent a source of bacterial contamination (Van Nostrand et al., 2017[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib12]; Rosenberg et al., 2021[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib15]). Using Bio-Rad membranes (Cat#1620115) we consistently obtained mapping rates between 80%–90%. If low mapping rates are encountered, consider changing membranes.
Assemble the transfer stack as follows: imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2158-Fx5.jpg
Critical: Use a roller to remove air bubbles trapped in the stack!
Note: We use the Thermo Fisher Scientific XCell II™ Blot Module in the XCell SureLock system. See manufacturer’s instructions available here: https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/EI9051[href=https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/EI9051].
Fill the blot module with 1× Transfer Buffer.
Transfer at 30 V, 90 min.
After the transfer, rinse the membrane in 1× PBS and wrap it in plastic wrap.
Pause point: Store the membrane at −80°C for 12–16 h.
Optional: If you performed P32-labeling: Tape the wrapped membrane to the cassette with intensifying screen (we use Kodak BioMax Cassette with BioMax MS Intensifying Screen). Use luminescent stickers to help aligning the developed film after exposure to the membrane.
Pause point: Expose the membrane to X-ray film for 12–16 h.
Fractionation and library preparation

Timing: 3 days
This second major step of the experimental pipeline extracts RNAs from protein-RNA complexes and converts isolated RNAs into cDNA high-throughput sequencing libraries.
Day 3
Membrane cutting (with or without fractionation).
Optional if you performed P32-labeling: after exposure for 12–16 h, proceed with autoradiographic visualization. Use the signal on the developed film as a mask for cutting out regions of interest. Remember that you are working with radioactive RNA!
Note: In case of experimental samples with absent or faint signal, see troubleshooting 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec7.1].
Cut each sample (and each fraction) with a fresh sterile scalpel blade.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2158-Fig1.jpg
Figure 1. Autoradiographic visualization and membrane size-selection
Top: representative U2AF1 freCLIP-seq membrane cutting to obtain U2AF1 light and heavy fractions in U2AF1 wildtype and mutant (S34F or Q157R) conditions. Figure adapted and reprinted with permission from (Biancon et al., 2022[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1]). Bottom: representative AGO2 eCLIP-seq membrane cutting to obtain AGO2-RNA complexes. See also Figure S1[href=https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2158-Mmc1.pdf].

Note: The average molecular weight of 70 nt long RNA is ∼20 kD. The 3′ RNA linker is 34 nt long, ∼10 kD. Cut the membrane considering the size of the protein with the crosslinked fragmented RNA (Huppertz et al., 2014[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7]; Van Nostrand et al., 2016[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib11]). For U2AF1 freCLIP-seq (Biancon et al., 2022[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1]), we cut a “light fraction” between 37 kD (U2AF1 size) and 65 kD, containing U2AF1 monomer plus bound RNA, and a “heavy fraction” between 65 kD (U2AF2 size) and 110 kD, containing U2AF2 and U2AF heterodimer plus bound RNA (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1] top panel). To apply our pipeline without membrane size fractionation, cut a lane from the protein size to approximately 80 kD above it. For AGO2 eCLIP-seq (Griffin et al., 2022[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib16]), according to our western blot results and to the signal on the developed film, we cut a lane starting between 75-100 kD (AGO2 size is 97 kD) and ending approximately at 250 kD (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1] bottom panel).
Note: Control samples should show absent or significantly reduced signal in comparison to experimental samples (Figure S1[href=https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2158-Mmc1.pdf]), resulting in insufficient material for library preparation and sequencing and therefore confirming insignificant non-specific binding.
Place each membrane region on a fresh glass slide and slice it into 1–2 mm pieces. Transfer all the pieces to a Low Binding 1.7 mL tube.
Critical: Use tweezers to remove the plastic wrap and handle the membrane but don’t forget to clean them with 70% ethanol and RNAse Away Reagent between each sample (and each fraction).
RNA extraction.
Submerge the membrane pieces in 200 μL Proteinase K Buffer. Add 10 μL Proteinase K. Incubate in a Thermomixer at 1,100 rpm, 37°C, 20 min.
Add 200 μL Proteinase K/Urea Buffer. Incubate in Thermomixer at 1,100 rpm, 37°C, 20 min.

Spin 2 mL Phase Lock Gel tubes at 16,000 × g, 23°C, 1 min before use.
Transfer the supernatant (without membrane slices) to a Phase Lock Gel tube.
Add 400 μL phenol/chloroform. Incubate in Thermomixer at 1,100 rpm, 30°C, 5 min.
Spin down at 16,000 × g, 23°C, 5 min.
Add 400 μL chloroform. Incubate in Thermomixer at 1,100 rpm, 30°C, 5 min.
Spin down at 16,000 × g, 23°C, 5 min.
Transfer the upper aqueous layer (350 μL, avoid the gel barrier) to 15 mL conical tube.
RNA Cleanup (RNA Clean & Concentrator-5 kit. All centrifugation steps are carried out at 13,000 × g, 23°C, 30 s).
Add 700 μL RNA Binding Buffer.
Add 1,050 μL ethanol 100% and mix.
Transfer 750 μL sample to Zymo-Spin IC Column. Spin down and discard flow-through. Repeat 2× to transfer all sample volume.
Add 400 μL RNA Prep Buffer. Spin down and discard flow-through.
Add 700 μL RNA Wash Buffer. Spin down and discard flow-through.
Add 400 μL RNA Wash Buffer. Spin down and discard flow-through. Centrifuge for additional 2 min.
Transfer column to a Low Binding tube. Add 12 μL DNase/RNase-Free Water to column, let sit for 1 min and spin down.
Pause point: Store the extracted CLIP RNA at −80°C.
Processing of pre-IP input samples.
Take out 10 μL from the pre-IP input samples stored at 4°C on Day 1.
FastAP treatment. Prepare FastAP Master Mix for n+1 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_17.csv
Mix, add 15.5 μL/sample, incubate in Thermomixer at 1,200 rpm, 37°C, 15 min.
PNK treatment. Prepare PNK Master Mix for n+1 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_18.csv
Mix, add 75 μL/sample, incubate in Thermomixer at 1,200 rpm, 37°C, 20 min. Then, short spin and magnetic separation.
Silane cleanup of input RNA (Dynabeads™ MyOne™ Silane).

Vortex Silane beads for 30 s. Magnetically separate 20 μL beads per sample in Low Binding tubes, remove supernatant.
Wash beads with 900 μL Buffer RLT (let sit 30 s).
Resuspend beads in 300 μL Buffer RLT and add them to sample, mix.
Add 10 μL 5 M NaCl.
Add 615 μL 100% EtOH.
Mix and rotate at 23°C for 15 min.
Magnetically separate and remove supernatant.
Resuspend beads in 1 mL 75% EtOH and move suspension to a new Low Binding tube.
After 30 s, magnetically separate and remove supernatant.
Wash beads 2× with 75% EtOH (let sit 30 s).
Quick spin and perform magnetic separation to remove residual liquid.
Air-dry 5 min (do not over-dry!).
Resuspend beads in 10 μL H2O, let sit 5 min.
Magnetically separate and transfer supernatant to new Low Binding tubes: 5 μL for proceeding with library preparation (keep on ice), 5 μL as backup sample (store at −80°C).
3′ linker ligation to input RNA.
Add 1.5 μL 100% DMSO.
Add 0.5 μL RiL19 barcoded RNA adapter at 40 μM.
Incubate in Thermomixer at 65°C, 2 min, no shaking. Place immediately on ice for at least 1 min.
Prepare 3′ Ligation Master Mix for n+1 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_19.csv
Mix carefully, add 13.8 μL/sample, flick, incubate at 23°C for 75 min (flick to mix every 15 min).
Silane cleanup of linker-ligated input RNA (Dynabeads™ MyOne™ Silane).
Vortex Silane beads for 30 s. Magnetically separate 20 μL beads per sample in Low Binding tubes, remove supernatant.
Wash beads with 900 μL Buffer RLT (let sit 30 s).
Resuspend beads in 61.6 μL Buffer RLT and add them to sample, mix.
Add 61.6 μL 100% EtOH. Mix every 5 min for 15 min.
Magnetically separate and remove supernatant.

Resuspend beads in 1 mL 75% EtOH and move suspension to a new Low Binding tube.
After 30 s, magnetically separate and remove supernatant.
Wash beads 2× with 75% EtOH (let sit 30 s).
Quick spin and perform magnetic separation to remove residual liquid.
Air-dry 5 min (do not over-dry!).
Resuspend beads in 10 μL H2O, let sit 5 min.
Magnetically separate and transfer supernatant to a new Low Binding tube.
Pause point: Store the extracted INPUT RNA at −80°C. CLIP and INPUT RNA samples are now all synchronized.
Day 4
Reverse transcription.
Primer annealing.
Thaw stored 10 μL CLIP and INPUT RNA samples.
Note: If you performed P32-labeling, CLIP samples are still radioactive.
Transfer all the samples to 8-tube PCR strips. Make a RTneg tube with 10 μL H2O.
Add 0.5 μL AR17 primer at 20 μM.
Place at 65°C for 2 min in pre-heated PCR block. Place immediately on ice for at least 1 min.
Prepare Reverse Transcription Mix for n+1 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_20.csv
Mix, add 10 μL/sample, incubate in pre-heated PCR block at 55°C, 45 min.
RT cleanup.
Add 3.5 μL ExoSAP-IT™ to each sample, pipette-mix.
Incubate in pre-heated PCR block at 37°C, 15 min.
Add 1 μL 0.5 M EDTA.
Add 3 μL 1 M NaOH, pipette-mix.
Incubate in pre-heated PCR block at 70°C, 12 min.
Add 3 μL 1 M HCl, pipette-mix.
Silane cleanup of cDNA (Dynabeads™ MyOne™ Silane).
Vortex Silane beads for 30 s. Magnetically separate 10 μL beads per sample in Low Binding tubes, remove supernatant.
Wash beads with 500 μL Buffer RLT (let sit 30 s).
Resuspend beads in 93 μL Buffer RLT and add them to sample, mix.

Add 111.6 μL 100% EtOH. Mix, let sit for 5 min, mix, let sit for other 5 min. Then, magnetically separate and remove supernatant.
Resuspend beads in 1 mL 80% EtOH and move suspension to a new Low Binding tube.
Note: If performed P32-labeling, at this point samples are not radioactive anymore.
After 30 s, magnetically separate and remove supernatant.
Wash beads 2× with 80% EtOH (let sit 30 s). Quick spin and perform magnetic separation to remove residual liquid.
Air-dry 5 min (do not over-dry!).
Resuspend beads in 5 μL 5 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5, let sit 5 min (do not remove from beads).
3′ linker ligation to cDNA (5′ ligation considering the original RNA fragment).
Add 0.8 μL rand3Tr3 ssDNA adapter at 80 μM.
Note: Added to single strand cDNA fragments, this adapter works as a randomer-UMI because it contains an inline randomer of 10 nt that allows to recognize and remove PCR duplicates.
Add 1 μL 100% DMSO.
Incubate in Thermomixer at 75°C, 2 min, no shaking. Place immediately on ice for at least 1 min.
Prepare 5′ Ligation Master Mix for n+1 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_21.csv
Mix carefully, add 13.5 μL/sample, mix by stirring contents.
Add another 1 μL T4 RNA Ligase High Concentration to each sample, flick to mix.
Incubate in Thermomixer at 1,200 rpm, 23°C, 30 s. Place tubes in a rack on your bench.
Pause point: Flick ideally every hour, at least twice, before incubating at 23°C for 12–16 h.
Day 5
Silane cleanup of linker-ligated cDNA (Dynabeads™ MyOne™ Silane).
Vortex Silane beads for 30 s. Magnetically separate 5 μL beads per sample in Low Binding tubes, remove supernatant.
Wash beads with 500 μL Buffer RLT (let sit 30 s).
Resuspend beads in 60 μL Buffer RLT and add them to sample, mix.

Add 60 μL 100% EtOH. Mix, let sit 5 min, mix, let sit other 5 min. Then, magnetically separate and remove supernatant.
Resuspend beads in 1 mL 75% EtOH and move suspension to a new Low Binding tube.
After 30 s, magnetically separate and remove supernatant.
Wash beads 2× with 75% EtOH (let sit 30 s). Quick spin and perform magnetic separation to remove residual liquid.
Air-dry 5 min (do not over-dry!).
Resuspend beads in 27 μL 10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5, let sit 5 min.
Magnetically separate, transfer 25 μL supernatant to a new Low Binding tube and place on ice.
cDNA quantification by qPCR.
Dilute cDNA samples 1:10 in H2O. As controls, use RT H2O (RTneg) and qPCR H2O. Samples and controls are quantified in triplicate.
Prepare qPCR Master Mix for n+3 samples as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_22.csv
Mix, add 9 μL/sample in 96 well qPCR plate, add 1 μL diluted cDNA or controls, mix, seal.
Run qPCR (“Quick Plate_96 wells_SYBR Only” 2-step protocol in the BIO-RAD CFX96 Touch Real-Time PCR Detection System) with the following cycling conditions:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_23.csv
Use automatically calculated Cq values. The number of cycles for final PCR amplification will be 3 cycles less than the Cq of the diluted CLIP sample.
Note: The “3 cycles less” rule may be adjusted considering the type of sample (CLIP or INPUT), final library concentration and possible adapter bands.
cDNA amplification.
Organize 8-tube PCR strips according to the Cq values of each sample.
Transfer 12.5 μL CLIP samples or 10 μL INPUT samples in the assigned strips. For each PCR strip, make a PCRneg tube with 10 μL H2O. Store the remaining 12.5 μL CLIP samples and 15 μL INPUT samples at −80°C for troubleshooting 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec7.3] (pre-AMP libraries).
Dispense PCR Master Mix in 8-tube PCR strips as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_24.csv

Note: For adapter pairs and sample pooling, we follow Illumina guidelines reported in Table S1[href=https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2158-Mmc1.pdf] (and previously available as document #770-2017-004-B). Refer to Illumina website for current guidelines: https://support.illumina.com/downloads/index-adapters-pooling-guide-1000000041074.html[href=https://support.illumina.com/downloads/index-adapters-pooling-guide-1000000041074.html]. Illumina adapters were purchased from Integrated DNA Technologies, IDT (100 nmole DNA Oligos, PAGE purification).
For PCRneg tubes, use adapter pair of one of the library samples in the strip.
Mix and run PCR with the following cycling conditions:
table:files/protocols_protocol_2158_25.csv
Note: INPUT samples are typically amplified with 9 total cycles (6+3); CLIP samples, especially freCLIP fractions, typically required 16–18 total cycles (6+10–12). If Cq value=22, keep 18 total cycles; if Cq value ≥22 but lower than H2O Cq, use 19 total cycles, do not increase further! As reported in Van Nostrand et al. (2016)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib11], 18 cycles will yield ∼30%–50% PCR duplicate reads.
SPRI cleanup of amplified libraries (AMPure XP beads).
Vortex AMPure XP beads for 30 s.
Add 90 μL beads to 50 μL PCR products, mix well and incubate at 23°C, 10 min (mix 2× during incubation).
Magnetically separate and remove supernatant.
Wash beads 2× with 75% EtOH (let sit 30 s).
Short spin and magnetic separation to remove residual liquid.
Air-dry 5 min (do not over-dry!).
Resuspend beads in 20 μL H2O, let sit 5 min.
Magnetically separate, transfer 18 μL supernatant to a new Low Binding tube (post-AMP libraries).
Pause point: Store at −80°C for up to one month before sequencing.
Optional: Library visualization by TBE-Urea gel.
Have ready the prepared 1× TBE Running Buffer.
Take out 6 μL purified post-AMP libraries and mix with 1 μL 6× loading dye.
Run libraries on 6% TBE-Urea gel at 180 V, 40 min.
Stain gel with GelStar™ (3 μL GelStar™ in 50 mL 1× TBE Running Buffer). Gentle shaking at 23°C, 10 min.

Visualize gel (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A). Library size should be between 175–350 bp.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2158-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Quality control of representative U2AF1 freCLIP-seq libraries before sequencing
(A) Visualization by TBE-Urea gel. Yellow lines mark the expected library size.
(B) Visualization by Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer. Peak size is reported. Lower and upper marker peaks are indicated, respectively, in green and purple. These libraries are ready for sequencing: 175–350 bp range (yellow box), good concentration, no adapter dimers (<10%), primer excess can be ignored.
Critical: Adapter dimers around 150 bp negatively affect sequencing. See troubleshooting 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec7.3].
Note: Primer excess (<100 bp) does not affect sequencing because these short fragments cannot bind to the flow cell. Consider buying new AMPure XP beads!
